values:
About 10 months ago, I started running again. It was slow. And painful. I started out with the Couch to 5K program, also known as C25K. I'd run one day and then have my ankle swell up the next day. Thankfully it didn't hurt, it would just swell to the size of a softball. But I kept going, repeating some of the weeks in the C25K program when I wasn't ready to move to the next week. Eventually my ankle stopped swelling. I still can't wear high heels anymore, if I do, I pay for it the next day with an achey ankle. So I solved this problem: I got rid of the high heels!

To date I have run five 5K road races, one 5.6 mile charity race for a fallen chief of police, and one 5K zombie laden obstacle course race (the Run For Your Lives race). Last fall I was trying to come up with a way to commemorate these runs and keep me motivated. I decided to get a Pandora bracelet and add a charm for every race. I have 6 charms and need to pick up a 7th for the 4th of July race I just ran.

My run times have sucked lately, they always do when it gets really hot and humid. It's been a lot of both lately here in Boston. I've actually been going back and forth on whether to wimp out and start hitting the gym several times a week instead of running outside. Not so lucky for me, that decision has kind of been make for me in the form of a heat rash. Thanks, body. What I did learn from this rash and the heat, wearing yoga capris to run is a bad idea. I've been buying those largely because I can get them cheap at Target. However, I think I'll suck it up and get good running capris at Athleta or Sports Authority. I've also been wearing the yoga capris because well, my ass is big and I hate seeing it in spandex or any other tech fabric. Vanity be damned, it's time to get rid of them. Well, actually I'll keep them for what they were made for- yoga!

This weekend I'll be hitting the gym instead of the pavement. I'll set the incline up slightly on the dreadmill (no, that's not a typo, I meant to type a d instead of a t) and go for my regular runs. Tomorrow I may even venture back into the weights too. It should help with the toning and strength, which will eventually improve my running.

On Monday  and I started the Insanity program. It's an intense exercise program, and I do mean intense! It's 6 days a week, 5 days of hardcore exercise and one day of slightly-less-hard-core exercise. We started Monday with what is called the Fit Test, a 30 minute set of exercises to count your reps and note. I noted my numbers, took my measurements and before photos. I finished the fit test coated in sweat. On Tusday we got down to business with a 40 minute plyometrics workout. I've been sore ever since!
Yesterday was 4/6 workouts and the "easy" day. And comparitively, it was easy. It was kind of a yoga, deep stretching 35 minute session. Much less sweaty then the other days, but still sweating.
Through all of this, I'm super sore. My calves are screaming WTF? on a daily hourly basis and my shoulders are threatening to revolt and walk off the job. Or just drop off the job possibly.
All of this pain and yet, I'm really enjoying this workout set! That is the definition of masochist, right? Who knew I had it in me? It's a 60 day program, and claims it can do in 60 days what would take a year in the gym. While I doubt I see those kind of results, it's a great start!
While I'm doing this intense program, I've taken a break from running. My plan is that this will help my running in the long run and kick start getting back into serious shape. Once I get to the one month mark, I'll take a look at the photos and probably post them. I lost 4.5lbs this week and while I am not expecting or even trying for that every week, I'll take it for the first week! A good start!

<lj-template id="3121" lang="en_LJ" name="qotd" />I love the quiet and peacefulness that blankets everything as the snow falls.

So Trevor and I moved into a 2 bedroom apartment last weekend. I have the living room put together (mostly) and the kitchen set up. The rest of the apartment is mostly still in boxes. So I can cook and watch TV! Oh yeah, and our king size bed is set up and we've been sleeping on it for the last week. Best week of sleep I've had in months! Can you see my priorities? Food, TV, and sleep!

I have this Friday off and all of next week. After Thursday, I don't go back to work until January 3, 2012. Trevor is taking the week after Christmas off for vacation, so we'll get everything unpacked and organized then. We are staying home for the holiday, the first time in years we've stayed home. We are looking forward to it.

About 8 weeks ago Trevor went to Tampa for his dad's 60th birthday as a surprise. Well, while he was gone I opened a bottle of wine (as I often do) and had a glass or three of wine while watching a movie. So I had gotten an email about a Yulefest 5K run for December 18th. I decided, "Why not?" and promptly signed up not just myself, but Trevor too. Fast forward to last week, we move and I've been so busy getting ready for that, that I've let my running slack off a lot. Not good. But, we've been in the 50's most days lately- a very unseasonably warm December. Fast forward again to today. This mornings temp when I got up at 7:30am was 18F. Ummm...COLD! So we got our cold weather running gear together and head out. By the time of the run at 10am, I think we were up to maybe 22 or 23. And we ran it. And survived. Really, it wasn't that bad all in all.
For the first few minutes I was dying. It was cold, my nose was running its own race- straight down my throat. I had a thing to go over my mouth and nose, but it kept pushing the warm breath upwards and fogging my sunglasses.  I finally pulled it down and kept going, but it did still help by keeping my neck warm. I wore my hooded sweatshirt over my running shirt and I won't do that again. I got too hot and ended up taking it off and tying it around my waist. I wore gloves too- excellent decision. I had a pair of running tights on AND a pair of yoga pants on over them, not for modesty (they were thick tights/leggings that can be worn alone) but rather because I was that cold. That was a good plan. I had a skull cap hat on too, another good decision. I stayed warm, but I didn't get uncomfortably hot. I finished my run in 39:24 and was pleased with that. I ran the Oktoberfest run in 39:21. I would possibly have done better, but I had to stop and retie my shoe at one point. Given the cold, I was just excited that I finished under 45 minutes.

So tomorrow is back to the grind. Work, and then the gym to run and do weights. Time to add in some strength training and get back on track with 5 days a week of workouts. Feeling good!
Homemade chicken soup and lots of hot tea.<lj-template id="3111" lang="en_LJ" name="qotd" />

I was living in New Orleans, Louisiana, on my way to work. I lived Uptown and worked at Tulane Medical School. I was running a little late that day and traffic was crazy. I was sitting in traffic and the DJ's on the radio stationed were saying a plane just went into the first tower a few minutes before. They'd gotten a TV turned on in their studio and I can still remember hearing the femail DJ scream when the second plane hit.
Once I got to work, the internet was overloaded, you couldn't get any information from the news sites. Media Services got CNN piped into the auditorium at the Medical School so we could get information.
As much as I would be tempted to keep it, I would take it to the police.

Really, I don't think it would do anything nice for my life. I'd be on my own time table and well, with ADD, that would not be good. Calendars and clocks are how I stay organized and keep a structure in my life.
I haven't stayed in touch with the majority of them. The break-ups were mostly amicable, I just suck at keeping in touch with people.

Oh heck yeah!

I had this little white cat, Skadi. When Skadi was a kitten we had just moved to a new house we'd bought. I had 2 twin mattresses leaning up against a wall in the hallway.  She had climbed up to the top of the mattresses and was watching the world from that little perch. She loved it up there. We also had Tavey, our puppy, by then. One evening Skadi dived off of the mattress as Tavey was walking by, landed on the puppies back, then bolted off to parts unknown. It's hard to explain but it was the funniest thing we'd seen in a long time!

Having 4 animals, I am positive they have a sense of humor as they never cease to stop making me laugh.

Mr. Alex Martinez emailed me to let me know that I just won 500,000.00 Euro from the Lottery International Program! All I have to do is send him my bank info and he'll deposit my winnings!!!

LOL! Some days spam makes me giggle.
He did the dishes for me this morning! He's absolutely awesome!

Anyone have a recommendation of a bicycle helmet that you just love? I need to buy one to ride here. I was bad about that when we lived in Lafayette because I we lived in a neighborhood with plenty of streets with low speed limits and weren't high in traffic anyway.

Happy St. Patrick's Day!!!

I'm very blunt and I'm not afraid to tell you exactly what I'm thinking. I do not sugar coat it, I just say what I'm thinking. Example: if you ask me if something makes you look fat, and it does, I'm going to tell you yes. I don't care how much you like the dress, if it's not attractive on you, I'm not doing you any favors by saying it looks great.

I know this annoys some people. I've never really tried to change it, I just don't tell people what I'm thinking if they don't ask. This refrain does not apply to good friends. LOL!  

I'm not sure this is really a habit or not, but I know it annoys people.

Anyone on my f'list an only child? If so, could you please comment to me. I'm writing a piece on being an only child and would like as many opinions and thoughts as possible. Or if any of you know someone that is an only child and wouldn't mind answering a few questions via email, please send them here. Thanks!

  and   y'all don't need to respond. I already know where to find you two! *weg*


ETA: If you are the parent of an only child and do not plan to have more children, I'd also like to ask y'all a few questions too!

Cell phones definitely. I love mine and will never give it up, but people just do not think. Texting while driving? Scary!! I think the most annoying is when students answer their phones in class! Hello people, turn off the phone when you're in class. That is just rude to everyone else in the room.

Pay off all of my debts. Buy a house somewhere close to an ocean and travel a lot. Oh and buy a brand spanking new Nikon D300 (or whatever is the newest model at the time) to photograph all of my travels. I'd also set up a scholarship fund of some kind or contribute to some other form of educational charity.

My preference is to stay up late. My ideal work schedule would start around 9 or 10am and knock off around 6 or 7-ish. Alas most jobs I have had and am applying for start much earlier than that, so no, my schedule does not usually fit my preference. I've gotten very good at pretending to be a morning person and getting to work early though with the help of lots of coffee!
